001package io.avaje.inject;
002
003import java.lang.annotation.Annotation;
004import java.util.List;
005
006/**
007 * Holds beans created by dependency injection.
008 * <p>
009 * The beans have singleton scope, support lifecycle methods for postConstruct and
010 * preDestroy and are created (wired) via dependency injection.
011 * </p>
012 *
013 * <h3>Create a BeanScope</h3>
014 * <p>
015 * We can programmatically create a BeanScope via {@code BeanScope.newBuilder()}.
016 * </p>
017 * <pre>{@code
018 *
019 *   // create a BeanScope ...
020 *
021 *   try (BeanScope scope = BeanScope.newBuilder()
022 *     .build()) {
023 *
024 *     CoffeeMaker coffeeMaker = context.get(CoffeeMaker.class);
025 *     coffeeMaker.makeIt()
026 *   }
027 *
028 * }</pre>
029 *
030 * <h3>External dependencies</h3>
031 * <p>
032 * We can supporting external dependencies when creating the BeanScope. We need to do 2 things.
033 * we need to specify these via
034 * </p>
035 * <ul>
036 *   <li>
037 *       1. Specify the external dependency via {@code @InjectModule(requires=...)}.
038 *       Otherwise at compile time the annotation processor detects it as a missing dependency and we can't compile.
039 *   </li>
040 *   <li>
041 *       2. Provide the dependency when creating the BeanScope
042 *   </li>
043 * </ul>
044 * <p>
045 * For example, given we have Pump as an externally provided dependency.
046 *
047 * <pre>{@code
048 *
049 *   // tell the annotation processor Pump is provided externally
050 *   // otherwise it thinks we have a missing dependency
051 *
052 *   @InjectModule(requires=Pump.class)
053 *
054 * }</pre>
055 * <p>
056 * When we build the BeanScope provide the dependency via {@link BeanScopeBuilder#withBean(Class, Object)}.
057 *
058 * <pre>{@code
059 *
060 *   // provide external dependencies ...
061 *   Pump pump = ...
062 *
063 *   try (BeanScope scope = BeanScope.newBuilder()
064 *     .withBean(Pump.class, pump)
065 *     .build()) {
066 *
067 *     CoffeeMaker coffeeMaker = context.get(CoffeeMaker.class);
068 *     coffeeMaker.makeIt()
069 *   }
070 *
071 * }</pre>
072 */
073public interface BeanScope extends AutoCloseable {
074
075  /**
076   * Build a bean scope with options for shutdown hook and supplying external dependencies.
077   * <p>
078   * We can optionally:
079   * <ul>
080   *   <li>Provide external dependencies</li>
081   *   <li>Specify a parent BeanScope</li>
082   *   <li>Specify specific modules to wire</li>
083   *   <li>Specify to include a shutdown hook (to fire preDestroy lifecycle methods)</li>
084   *   <li>Use {@code forTesting()} to specify mocks and spies to use when wiring tests</li>
085   * </ul>
086   *
087   * <pre>{@code
088   *
089   *   // create a BeanScope ...
090   *
091   *   try (BeanScope scope = BeanScope.newBuilder()
092   *     .build()) {
093   *
094   *     CoffeeMaker coffeeMaker = context.get(CoffeeMaker.class);
095   *     coffeeMaker.makeIt()
096   *   }
097   *
098   * }</pre>
099   */
100  static BeanScopeBuilder newBuilder() {
101    return new DBeanScopeBuilder();
102  }
103
104  /**
105   * Return a single bean given the type.
106   *
107   * <pre>{@code
108   *
109   *   CoffeeMaker coffeeMaker = beanScope.get(CoffeeMaker.class);
110   *   coffeeMaker.brew();
111   *
112   * }</pre>
113   *
114   * @param type an interface or bean type
115   */
116  <T> T get(Class<T> type);
117
118  /**
119   * Return a single bean given the type and name.
120   *
121   * <pre>{@code
122   *
123   *   Heater heater = beanScope.get(Heater.class, "electric");
124   *   heater.heat();
125   *
126   * }</pre>
127   *
128   * @param type an interface or bean type
129   * @param name the name qualifier of a specific bean
130   */
131  <T> T get(Class<T> type, String name);
132
133  /**
134   * Return the list of beans that have an annotation.
135   *
136   * <pre>{@code
137   *
138   *   // e.g. register all controllers with web a framework
139   *   // .. where Controller is an annotation on the beans
140   *
141   *   List<Object> controllers = beanScope.listByAnnotation(Controller.class);
142   *
143   * }</pre>
144   *
145   * @param annotation An annotation class.
146   */
147  List<Object> listByAnnotation(Class<?> annotation);
148
149  /**
150   * Return the list of beans that implement the interface.
151   *
152   * <pre>{@code
153   *
154   *   // e.g. register all routes for a web framework
155   *
156   *   List<WebRoute> routes = beanScope.list(WebRoute.class);
157   *
158   * }</pre>
159   *
160   * @param interfaceType An interface class.
161   */
162  <T> List<T> list(Class<T> interfaceType);
163
164  /**
165   * Return the list of beans that implement the interface sorting by priority.
166   */
167  <T> List<T> listByPriority(Class<T> interfaceType);
168
169  /**
170   * Return the beans that implement the interface sorting by the priority annotation used.
171   * <p>
172   * The priority annotation will typically be either <code>javax.annotation.Priority</code>
173   * or <code>jakarta.annotation.Priority</code>.
174   *
175   * @param interfaceType The interface type of the beans to return
176   * @param priority      The priority annotation used to sort the beans
177   */
178  <T> List<T> listByPriority(Class<T> interfaceType, Class<? extends Annotation> priority);
179
180  /**
181   * Return all the bean entries from the scope.
182   * <p>
183   * The bean entries include entries from the parent scope if it has one.
184   *
185   * @return All bean entries from the scope.
186   */
187  List<BeanEntry> all();
188
189  /**
190   * Close the scope firing any <code>@PreDestroy</code> lifecycle methods.
191   */
192  void close();
193}
